reviews.text: The small grocery store has a surprising variety of imported Japanese products. Parking and food is good here, great place to expand your mind. The best place to learn more about the Japanese and Canadian History! Good for all ages!
Came here for the Japanese festival. They had food trucks and activities inside and a small grocery store connected to the complex.  It's nice to just check out when there's events there.
Beautiful, informative displays. The museum section I think is free for students (or super cheap.)
The Nikkei National Museum was a good visit. It was a nice look into cultural Japanese/ Japanese Canadian history. All in all, a good informative museum with some Japanese cultural artifacts.
Lots of variety of activities for kids & adults alike. Nice & clean facilities - a good place to bring the whole family when there are special events!

First time here and they were great. Cal at the front was telling guests the COVID-19 rules and carts were being sanitized before use. He was just the perfect person for telling guests what to do and the rules. We did wine tasting here, we had waffles, and we took home two pies. Everything was great and everything was surprisingly socially distanced. I didn't get anxiety here about anyone being too close to me. The pies were delicious. Come here for all your Christmas goods and support a great local business. They also have great gift packages all ready to go for gifting for those last minute gifts on your list.
Amazing vegan gluten free waffles
Delicious waffles

Gone here a few times over the years, its always a great time and so so beautiful. This year I went with a friend and we picked so many blueberries and strawberries, so sweet and yummy! (and at a great price!) All staff are very welcoming and kind :)

The customer service was excellent. I was disappointed once I got home and read the ingredients of the preserves I bought. It might be good to warn shoppers that there is dairy inside all the jams and jellies. Online shopping...

Now I have never rated a casino before however I thought I probably should after my recent experience here. Now I should begin by saying I actually had quick a fantastic night here. Won a jackpot on the slots and had a really fun time for a few hours after and walked out absolutely even. I am removing the two stars for a couple of reasons. The first star The Hard Rock lost is due to our dealer on a blackjack table. The poor gentleman was quite friendly but clearly struggling when it came to counting cards. Now I’m all for equal opportunity however being able to do simple addition seems like a fairly important job requirement for a casino dealer. The second star that I have removed is due to the extremely poor attitude of a drink server. She was either just having a rough night or something else might have been wrong but her attitude was really not very appropriate especially after even giving her a couple dollars for a coke as a tip. In a casino I would expect that the service should be on point. Especially when people are literally giving thousands to the establishment. I will return to the Hard Rock because it still is a great casino, I just hope that some of these smaller issues might be resolved.
I enjoy the venue section and it's great to be able to do a bit of gambling on your way in or out. Also who can deny the buffet lol

Always a good time at hard Rock. Nice more happier staff in general and gets very busy on weekends. Brings a decent variety of people because of location. Minus one star because the baccarat squeeze tables are minimum $50 dollars whereas other casinos offer squeeze table starting at $25

Saw a concert there. Great facility nice, clean, functional. Dining area was decent, great tasting food and reasonable prices with quick friendly service. Casino was nice, security helpful and courteous. Thoroughly enjoyed all my time and experiences there, highly recommend.

Great night ! We had an event in the Asylum and the servers was very friendly and prompt.   The casino was fun.  The staff were funny and interactive with us.
Great environment.
Only complaint is there is no hotel ! Would have loved to stay there instead of hopping into a cab and heading some where else.

My friends and I tried curling for the first time here. It was physically harder than we thought but worth trying something new for a girls day out. The facility is clean and the staff were helpful giving us a shortened version of the rules and techniques for curling.

I phoned customer service trying to cancel my kid Pro D Day schedule on Oct 23rd and was advised to send email to camp@richmondoval.ca. Until this review posted, unfortunately, I haven't received any response whatsoever and highly unlikely will receive refund. At the very least, please show professional courtesy by sending email response. Very disappointing for international class sport facility.

It was my first visit in this beautiful facility. I received great customer service from Jean at the Concession shop. She was engaged, friendly and very helpful. I purchased a shaker bottle and she offered me to try the protein mix. Been a regular gym-goer in Richmond, customer services from the gyms are mediocre to poor. But Jean and this facility’s staff are great! Highly recommended!!
We came to watch some speed skating and we were not disappointed. Great races, nice to see Canada win.

Stack 'em pack' em and rack 'em...... 10 kids share a 15ft linear piece of ice to learn skating. Instructors are sub par and rather play vs teach. Private lesson (1kid) takes up a quarter of the entire ice. Won't be coming back here.
View is amazing, food is overpriced and not so good. Go enjoy a beer and the view.
Beautiful to see

Such a busy port , lots of things going onto see .
ships, boats,  trains and sea planes an ideal place for viewing the area.
We arrived just before nightfall watching the sun set as the town was gradually lighting up. Beautiful
We spent an hour or so in the lookout viewing platform. There is plenty to see. Staff are friendly and there are markers to indicate places of interest. We thought it was good value. Recommended!
Great way to see the city from above and get your bearings. Tickets are valid all day so you can go during both daylight and at sunset if you want.

5.name: Dr. Sun Yat-Sen Classical Chinese Garden

reviews.text: It is a quite place to chill out for a bit.

Absolutely love Dr. Sun Yat-Sens garden!

Me and my family and friends have visited to explore the gardens many times now! Each visit at different time of year showing a range of seasons to suite.

The garden has great speakers who know a lot about the architectural history and culture surrounding the site.

There has been several engaging activities at the end of the tour each time we have visited including: A tea ceremony, Character tile painting and Art residencies!

This garden will forever hold a place in our hearts and we will continue to visit when we can! Highly recommend! 5 Stars *****

Fascinating garden for a visit and worth the price of admission. Incredibly peaceful. Interesting how it’s all made without nails or screws for those interested in architecture or have building experience.
Gift shop is also very good with lots of non cookie cutter items that are handmade and fairly priced.
Staff was also friendly and helpful. Once Covid19-84 is over be sure to ask a volunteer for a tour to back more background information.

What must have been a beautiful garden before is just not worth visiting now.Went last week with the expectations to see a beautiful garden but the place needs lots of maintenance . The small water streams were dirty. The place needs thorough cleaning. The worst part was that the garden was occupied by many drug addicts and homeless. The neighborhood  also is not very welcoming.  Felt total waste of time.

A beautiful and serene garden in the middle of the city. We went during the pandemic so the free side that's run by the city was inaccessible to us and there were only two other visitors there in the paid part when we visited. But the paid part of the garden was absolutely stunning. There were a variety of bonsai trees and we were also able to witness the crane? fly from the pond up onto the roof. Definitely worth a visit.

6.name: Fort Langley National Historic Site of Canada

reviews.text: Due to COVID-19 you can't go anywhere but around.. And the price to enter is still the same..

Small but peaceful and beautiful Fort Langley has one more thing to offer. This historical site provides a glimpse view of historical fort living. More fun activities or things to see inside the fort could be added in my opinion. Good location for casual weekend visit.

Explore Canada's history by walking through this HBC fort from the 1800s.  Dressed up characters from the era explains thoroughly the history behind every single piece of equipment and buildings on site.  But COVID means you can't walk through any of the buildings, which is quite unfortunate.

For those with annual passes from last year, the government extended the validity of the pass by 4 months! Make sure if it while you can!

A pleasant few hours here, just wandering around the buildings and the main grounds. Some buildings closed and some limited access because of covid. Very quiet and nice to talk to the staff, not rushed at all. A good day out here in the town as well.

The fort is a wonderful place to go to learn about historic Fort Langley. I also highly recommend their Grave Tales tour. What a fun way to get spooked (and learn about some of the prominent historical figures who founded the community) during Halloween season!
Friendly service but price is too high

I have been buying wine from PBW for several years now and I simply love their selection and wine tasting!  Their Chardonnay last year was amazing and they always have such a welcoming  atmosphere.  Their pricing is great and I love supporting a local business run by people that live right here in New West!  It doesn't get any better than that!

Wonderful place
Enjoyed the tastings
Loved the dessert wine: Muscat Canelli

Great little hidden gem in New Westminister. They offer tours of the facilities and provide samples during.

You can buy directly from them which is great, especially if you come across a wine that you now love after the tour!
Love the wines, and love the staff there. very friendly service, with reasonable wine pricing.
Great atmosphere and lots of room for everyone
Needs more places to sig. Either benches or picnic tables. Not very accessible.
Excellent park with new installments and new projects many times a year. I would give it a 5 star if some people that party under the roofed tables wouldn't leave so much trash behind.
I live next door to this beautiful sports park. Has a daycare and a play area. I take my dog & grandkids out for walks every day.
Fun park with different levels of interactivity for children to explore and have fun

Basic and simple buffet.
All food has the smells and tastes that a lot of coconut oil is used. Coconut oil has been mentioned in the news that it is one of the most unhealthy oil to use, since it has one of the highest saturated fat.

It affects your health very much. It would be better if the kitchen can use more healthy type oil in making their food.

If you do not want yourself and your family to have serious heart or other health problems, then please do not use coconut oil in preparing the food.

It's pretty hard to expect much from the service people. I've heard this player beside me on table games telling this dealer to die and hang herself, while supervisors does nothing when they were right beside. Dealers are constantly belittled and they don't respond as if they don't have a backbone...or is it because the casino management doesn't support them ?
It doesn't surprise me that most of the dealers look very tired and unhappy. How can you expect people to give customer service when they themselves are treated horribly...I worked in a really good casino 30 years ago in the USA. Tips were good, players complain but they don't tell dealers or their family to die . Pretty bad company.

Great staff here, and large selection of machines and tables here. The horse racing is by far my favourite part of coming here. Being able to see the races live whether inside or outside is amazing!!!!! It's an over all great place to come and enjoy an entertaining evening

Not too bad of a Casino and they have lots of free parking. The Buffet is not to bad and it’s well priced. The one bonuses they have a pop and coffee machine where it’s all complementary. Make sure you get a players card before you start gambling
Great comedy club but they do not serve food.  Comedy show is too notch and only $12 online tickets.  The casino itself isn't do great.  Regular buffet is terrible.  Huge line up for lobster buffet.
Best Anglican Cathedral in Vancouver.

I can only comment on beauty from the outside as it was closed when were here.  A beautiful sight to be seen and even though I am not Anglican I do want to visit a service once Covid settles down.  Looking at the site it looks like this is a very LGBTQ 🏳️‍🌈 friendly place which is honestly very refreshing in this day and age. I feel bad for everyone who regularly attends and now has to zoom and live stream due to the pandemic.
Amazing space, the Gregorian chants are absolutely incredible. So blessed to have such talented people!!

Although a cathedral, the architecture and design here is much less flamboyant than many other cathedrals. But it is still replete with wonderful carved timbers. The building doesn't seem particularly big from the outside, but feels much more spacious on the inside. Very quiet during my visit.
Very friendly staff and respectful, nice  , very helpful. friendly neighborhood church.  Highly recommended this  church

Nice beach . Free parking I believe 99.9% sure . I actually slept in my van overnight here spare of moment choice being tired on a long drive. I don’t think I was the only one. Out door shower open 24 hour but toilets do close at night ..
looks like maybe you can have fires on the beach. And the tide is one to be seen. I’ve never seen a tide go so far out
City. Nature. Sea. Sky. Mountain. All in one view. One of my favourite beaches in the city. It can get extremely busy on a sunny day but it’s fairly big and there’s lots of parking

Walked out to the ocean today, about a km. from beach to water's shoreline at low tide. Weather was sunny and warm with a cooling breeze. Great family opportunity! Some people were swimming, as was a dog, and others were playing in the flats making sandcastles, skim boarding on the ponds, and beach combing. The views of the Vancouver skyline, mountains, surf, and ships awaiting entry into the harbour was spectacular. No toys required!

Walking the handy shoreline of Spanish Banks, you suddenly realize this is the quintessential Vancouver experience; taking in the breathtaking skies, cool breeze, and panoramic views of the city that surrounds you: West End, North and West Vancouver, as well as the misty islands that lie beyond, and probably go on forever. Many have come here before you, only to decide to make this cosmopolitan region the stage on which to build their livelihood and home. Languages from all over the world surround you as bits of finely woven conversations drift by, swiftly carried away on endless wind, leaving you to while away the hours, lost in thought, far out on the trembling tidel flats, with one's best friend barking and splashing by your side. Parking fills up fast, so car pool if you can.
Beautiful  Beach ⛱ with great views of  Vancity and the Rocky Mountains ⛰🏔 . Great for picnics and has many tables to accommodate.✌🏾🖖🏾😁
Little pricy for the family to go to the watersides but overall a good time
Overpriced but it was fun, especially with the kids :)

This was definitely a bit of a childhood goal for me, to come here! It may sound weird but I remember when this place opened up in the '80s and as a child my parents never brought me. Now as a 40-year-old I was finally able to bring my son and we spent half a day here checking out all of the slides. I really liked that they had a cafe on site and the food was made with care and very tasty. It definitely made for a really nice day

It's amazing. The best place you could go on the summer days. I had so much fun with my friends. This water park is wonderful, has a variety of slides with different levels of difficulty. It is suitable for all family members.

The stuff was friendly and their COVID measures were on the spot.

Next Summer, I think I will take the year pass so I could go many times

Highly recommended

The season closes soon but we will definitely return, next year. Yesterday was a fun day and the reservation system worked well. Also, the line into the park, the directional arrows, the announcements and the park's current capacity size. The countdown to closing, was just excellent and the kids had so much fun in that last hour. This was priceless. Also no cigarette smoke was a delight, but we could smell raw sewage from time to time.

Absolutely amazing! We stopped in Vancouver for a day on the last day of our vacation last year and we decided to go here. Best decision ever, it's really awesome! The views are incredible and even if you're afraid of heights you'll have a great time walking over the bridges, which are safe, secured very well, and never swayed for us at all. There's also an area with many smaller bridges between trees in a forest, which is so fun to go through! Great for kids and adults alike, definitely recommend going here!

I just love suspension bridge. You can spend a day in the park. Plenty of places to take amazing photos. The view is spectacular! Walking over the suspension bridge was thrilling and breathtaking. I will for sure suggest it for both tourists and residents. I have never been there for Christmas but i heard there are lots of decorations and lights.

Over-priced.  Yes, there are nice views, but they rush you off the bridge.  It's also annoying when people shake the bridge. There's lots of walking and stairs.  I recommend that you be physically capable. $4.25 for a bottle of water?!? Really Capilano. The best part was actually the free shuttle.  It was on time and Sean (the driver) is fantastic. Very informative.

If you are not driving there, make sure to see to places in Vancouver where you can get the free shuttle.
The park is beautiful and has more things to do besides the suspension bridge. It;s great for family and kids.
On the other hand, the food places are average at best and in the last two times I've been there, there was no coffee available at the coffee shop.

Fantastic park and conservation centre. We went later on a Sunday and it made for a much better experience than some of the other photos where the place looked packed. So beautiful to experience what nature has to offer, the suspension bridge and cliff walk were truly one of a kind experiences with breathtaking views of the mountains and forest. It was awesome to see they took conservation and education seriously as well. Plus, if you visit and you're a BC resident, you can apply for a pass to visit an unlimited number of times FREE for a year. Will definitely go back!

Lovely park and lake. The trails were nice and even so even I could walk them, despite my weak leg. There are one way signs all over to make it easier to avoid people, which is lovely for covid and also just in general. Beautiful views and almost no garbage. The air was also very crisp. I took a friend from Brazil around on a video tour and she loved it!

Love this gentle trail walk. It's good for beginners if you park downstairs and don't want inclines. You can go the whole way or stick to the right exit you'll find halfway. It'll be a wooden walkway. This takes you back to the beginning. If you want it to be a little harder. Park up on Sperling and walk up the stairs or the hidden Forest trail that takes a scenic route. Check the maps for details and remember it's one way walk following the left side path due to covid. Enjoy you walks!

Deer Lake Park is a beautiful place to escape the hustle and bustle of urban life in Burnaby. It's a lovely natural setting filled with views of the mountains, nature and sounds of singing birds. Excellent trails surrounding the lake and boat rental place near Western parking lot offers kayaks, canoes and paddle boats.
Great to have this park and lake except for goose excrement fouling the beach and picnic areas. Gross.

Deer Lake Park Festival Lawn is probably my favorite music venue in the Lower Mainland. This outdoor  venue is in a beautiful treed setting overlooking a small lake. The lawn is beautifully maintained and always green even during the dry spells. KIDS: Children 10 years and under are free to attend with a supervising adult which gives it a nice family feel. Drinkers and kids are notoriously absent minded and you'll want to pay attention that partiers don't spill beer on your kids. Even in summer, the grass gets damp in the evening... bring something to sit on.
GETTING THERE: The park easily accessible by car, public transit and close to the freeway. There's plenty of free parking at the school for weekend and evening events and it's only a couple of blocks away from the venue. Traffic is usually managed effectively by the local police.
SMOKING: even though this area is deemed as non-smoking, you will find plenty of people lined up in certain areas smoking cigarettes and throughout the entire venue smoking a lot of marijuana. It's best to sit on the west side of the lawn (right side facing the stage) because the wind usually blows eastward and this will protect you from getting out too much smoke in your face.
WASHROOMS: Lots and lots of portable units specifically designated male and female. Normally I don't care whether I have a gender-specific washroom, but when there's a lot of drinking and low light I do appreciate the effort to keep us girls clean.
DRINKING WATER: There's only one drinking station and it's at the back on the right hand (west) side near the washrooms. You may bring an empty water bottle.
FOOD:  There is a limited selection of the usual event type food (and prices) for sale and lineups can be long. No outside food is permitted. I recommend eating at home beforehand. If you accidentally bring food, you can easily eat it outside the venue before you come in still listen to the music while you wait.
BERR: Yes there's beer! In plastic cups with a limit of two per person per purchase. So you can go back and get more if you can afford it.

I have fond memories of this place from when I was a kid and we came here on school trips, though back then, they had laser shows!
My husband loves this place because one of the narrators has "the most relaxing voice" he's heard and honestly, that is the main reason we go here at least once a year. I think one time, we were in the same elevator with the narrator because we saw him at the podium once we went in. Our son really likes this place, too, but I think for all the learning and hands-on stuff because I think he's a little too young to really understand the presentations. Have to say though, I love the mini-shows because the presenters have little to work with in terms of audience participation/enthusiasm, but they're still super into it! We have the Entertainment book and they have a coupon in there if you need discounts.

Came here for the planetarium, which was interesting. A mind-blowing and fascinating experience to be able to visualize how vast the universe really is. Planetarium was great, but other than that there just isn't really a lot to do here. The observatory was opened when we came, but because it was cloudy we couldn't look through any telescopes. Paid $15 for evening admission. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable.

This is small and mostly for kids but they staff was really great and helpful. They were very engaged and helpful and the whole day is filled with either a presentation or a movie. I saw presentations about science and fire as well as a really informative movie about dark matter. They also have a moon rock you can touch and a meteorite that you can lift.

I went here with my grade 3 class in 2016. The show was amazing and it felt like I was in space. We also made puppets and learned a lot about space. We saw how astronauts ate and drink in space and this is what lead me to become an astronaut (not yet, but future)

Small and expensive. Space exhibition is outdated and bland. The vancouver museum is better but too expensive. The best attraction is actually the building itself. There are some stunningly framed views of downtown vancouver. Best viewed in winter when the trees have lost their leafs. Entry should be free and would save them the cost of the 4 people sitting at the entry doing very little.

Interesting and informative! The centre is geared towards kids but adults can definitely have fun there. Got to learn about the Fraser river, build a keystone arch around salmon, play a sturgeon life history game, read about first nation peoples who grew up around the river, balance a cargo ship, and shape how the Fraser might look like depending on our planning and actions.
All great people love visit historical monument and museum or fair and exhibition ...I would say they all must visit this place..either you will like or learn something..
Awesome place with lots of interesting facts and details about the Fraser River. Little bit smaller so you won't spend all day here but has lots of activities for the kids. Would recommend
Good family place to visit, kids can learn while having fun.  Fantastic place for kids birthday party !!

It's a very small center. There are not many exhibits but a few of them were fun. The fish exhibit with the life stages was neat. This museum could be better if it had more wild life specimens and more indigenous culture exhibits I think. It was very focused on industry it seemed like. The cost of $15 for a family is very fair. I don't think it's worth going to the center alone but there is the Riverside market near by and the boardwalk so you could make an afternoon of going to all 3.

It was a beautiful day on the holiday Monday that we went! We were there just for a day on the South Beach on Allouette Lake. We got there nice and early (9:30am) so we could have ample parking and a good selection of a spot on the beach. It was nice to have the place to ourselves for a couple hours before it got very busy! Be sure to wake up really early and book your pass online because they go really fast! especially for the hiking!

Hikes are not so hard but some elevations can give you a good workout. Bring your horses and go for horse ride on the horse trails. Camping sites are currently closed but can be accessed by driving another 5 kms ahead. Beautiful, quiet spots. It can be little cold even on a hot summer day as the area is quite damp, so layer up!

Loved the outdoor adventures here. GOLDEN EARS IS AWESOME. Loved the trails, have easy to hard levelled trails for all hikers. Great views all around. So many things to do and see (hiking, camping, boating, beach etc). We tried lower falls trail which really easy and short but great views and waterfall is beautiful.

This is a beautiful place to go for easy and more advanced hikes. The space is vast. The views in every direction are spectacular. There are lakes and waterfalls to enjoy. The park entrance is not far from all the town's amenities. There's lots of parking and good signage throughout the park.
Day use passes required even if you aren't camping. They are freely available at discovercamping.ca from 6am for the same day.
